desc: list remote repos
name: git remote -v

desc: "bookmark" remote repo
name: git remote add {NAME} {GIT REPO URL}

desc: remove remote repo
name: git remote rm {NAME}

desc: shows remote branches and tracked or not, local branches for git pull, and local branches for git push
name: git remote show origin

desc: cleans up deleted remote branches
name: git remote prune origin

desc: Fetches from origin and syncs repo
name: git pull

desc: fetches and rebases new changes
name: git pull --rebase

desc: shows unstaged changes
name: git diff

desc: Shows staged differences
name: git diff --stage

desc: same as git diff
name: git diff HEAD

desc: compares to parent of latest commit
name: git diff HEAD^

desc: compares to grandparent of latest commit
name: git diff HEAD^^

desc: compares to 5 commits ago
name: git diff HEAD~5

desc: compares second most recent commit vs. most recent
name: git diff HEAD^..HEAD

desc: compares 2 different commits (identified by their hash)
name: git diff 4fb063f..f5a6ff9

desc: diff master to branch
name: git diff master bird

desc: git diff by time range
name: git diff --since=1.week.ago --until=1.minute.ago

desc: commits staged file changes
name: git commit -m "{COMMIT MESSAGE}"

desc: Adds changes from tracked files and commits
name: git commit -a -m "{COMMIT MESSAGE}"

desc: Add files to the last commit
name: git commit --amend -m "{NEW COMMIT MESSAGE IF NEEDED}"
*** DONT DO THESE AFTER A PUSH! ***

desc: unstages FILENAME from commit
name: git reset HEAD {FILENAME}

desc: Undo last commit and stage the changes from the commit
name: git reset --soft HEAD

desc: Undo last commit and revert file changes
name: git reset --hard HEAD^

desc: Undo last 2 commits and revert file changes
name: git reset --hard HEAD^^

desc: pushes local branch to remote branch
name: git push origin {BRANCH_NAME}

desc: deletes remote branch
name: git push origin :branch_name

desc: pushes new tags
name: git push --tags

desc: push all repos including submodules
name: git push --recurse-submodules=on-demand

desc: discard changes to FILENAME
name: git checkout -- {FILENAME}

desc: Switches timelines to BRANCH NAME branch
name: git checkout {BRANCH NAME}

desc: Creates new branch BRANCH NAME and switches to it
name: git checkout -b {BRANCH NAME}

desc: Creates new branch with BRANCH NAME
name: git branch {BRANCH NAME}

desc: lists remote branches
name: git branch -r

desc: delete local branch (will error if unsaved changes)
name: git branch -d branch_name

desc: force delete on local branch
name: git branch -D branch_name

desc: list all branches local and remote
name: git branch -a

desc: merges BRANCH-NAME into current branch
name: git merge {BRANCH NAME}

desc: forces a recursive merge rather than a fast-forward
name: git merge --no-ff feature_branch
A tag is a reference to a commit (used mostly for release versioning)

desc: lists all tags
name: git tag

desc: adds a new tag
name: git tag -a TAG -m "TAG MESSAGE"

desc: sets name for your user
name: git config --global user.name

desc: sets global git email
name: git config --global user.email

desc: enables colored terminal output
name: git config --global color.ui true

desc: use emacs for interactive commands
name: git config --global core.editor emacs

desc: use opendiff for merging conflicts (OS X only)
name: git config --global merge.tool opendiff

desc: lists set config options
name: git config --list

desc: sets email for current repo
name: git config user.email "johnpribesh@gmail.com"

desc: auto correct differences in OS line formatting (OS X)
name: git config --global core.autocrlf input

desc: auto correct differences in OS line formatting (WINDOWS)
name: git config --global core.autocrlf true

desc: Set the configuration for a single repo
name: git config --local

desc: Set the configuration for your user
name: git config --global

desc: Set the configuration for all users
name: git config --system

desc: view config file
name: cat ~/.gitconfig

desc: list local (repo specific) config
name: cat .git/config

desc: records all fixes to merge conflicts and reuses them automatically if the same conflict recurs
name: git config --global rerere.enabled true

desc: creates alias for git mylog
name: git config --global alias.mylog \\n"log --pretty=format:'%h %s [%an]' --graph"

desc: creates alias for git lol
name: git config --global alias.lol \\n"log --graph --decorate --pretty=oneline --abbrev-commit --all"

desc: Prints one commit per line with hash and message
name: git log --pretty=oneline

desc: (patch) shows lines added and removed for each changed file
name: git log --oneline -p

desc: shows how many lines were removed and added for each file
name: git log --oneline --stat

desc: shows visual representation of the branches merging into master
name: git log --oneline --graph

desc: commit log for last 24 hours
name: git log --since=1.day.ago

desc: commit log for the past hour
name: git log --since=1.hour.ago

desc: commit log from beginning until 1 minute ago
name: git log --until=1.minute.ago

desc: commit log between month month and 2 weeks ago. (relative)
name: git log --since=1.month.ago --until=2.weeks.ago

desc: commit log between 2000-01-01 and 2012-12-21 (absolute)
name: git log --since=2000-01-01 --until=2012-12-21

desc: shows the reflog in full log format
name: git log --walk-reflogs

desc: shows changes for every line in file and who made them
name: git blame index.html --date short

desc: deleted from local file system and staged
name: git rm README.txt

desc: stops tracking file but doesn't delete from local system
name: git rm --cached development.log

desc: keeps staged files
name: git stash save --keep-index

desc: restores previously stashed changes
name: git stash apply

desc: runs  a command on code and re-commits
name: git filter-branch --tree-filter 'SHELLCMD'

desc: runs on all commits on all branches
name: git filter-branch --tree-filter <SHELLCMD> -- --all

desc: adds specific commit form another branch to current branch
name: git cherry-pick 5ff34e3

desc: allows for new commit message
name: git cherry-pick --edit 5ff34e3

desc: add the file changes to current stage
name: git cherry-pick --no-commit 5ff34e3 2hf789e

desc: adds source hash to commit message
name: git cherry-pick -x 5ff34e3

desc: adds "cherry-picker" to commit message
name: git cherry-pick --signoff 5ff34e3

desc: goes through .gitmodules file and adds an entry to config for each submodule
name: git submodule init

desc: clones submodules into project, or updates submodules if they already exist in project
name: git submodule update

desc: gits "second log" that is local only. updated anytime HEAD moves (due to new commits, checking out branches, or resetting
name: git reflog
